snippet: At least, that's what the rapper Ja Rule calls Tyco International's former chief executive, L. Dennis Kozlowski, one of several financial figures who's part of his circle of prison friends, according to The Daily News of New York. "Koz" urged Ja Rule...
abstract: At least, that's what the rapper Ja Rule calls Tyco International's former chief executive, L. Dennis Kozlowski, one of several financial figures who's part of his circle of prison friends, according to The Daily News of New York. "Koz" urged Ja Rule to buy airline stocks and study business, while New York State's former comptroller, Alan G. Hevesi, chats about politics.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

lead_paragraph: At least, that's what the rapper Ja Rule calls Tyco International's former chief executive, L. Dennis Kozlowski, one of several financial figures who's part of his circle of prison friends, according to The Daily News of New York. "Koz" urged Ja Rule to buy airline stocks and study business, while New York State's former comptroller, Alan G. Hevesi, chats about politics. Read more »
